scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana - Special Projects
description: The Special Projects component of PMKVY provides project-based skilling interventions primarily for marginalized and vulnerable groups, including Scheduled Castes, Tribes, transgender individuals, Persons with Disabilities (PwDs), women, and economically backward people, as well as those from difficult/remote geographies. This component facilitates training in special areas, premises of government/corporate bodies, and in job roles not defined under standard Qualification Packs (QPs)/National Occupational Standards (NOS). It allows for deviations from regular short-term training guidelines to offer innovative strategies, captive placement opportunities, local livelihood through entrepreneurship, and international placements, aiming to enhance the all-round competency of marginalized sections.
benefits: Counselling services, including an online information/counselling platform, a counselling helpline, and district-level skill information centers.
Training in digital content, soft skills, entrepreneurship, financial and digital literacy.
Additional support including accidental insurance (Kaushal Bima of Rs. 2 lakhs for 3 years) for certified candidates.
One-time incentive to all certified candidates.
Additional support specifically for PwD candidates.
Provision of an induction kit and participant handbook.
Post-training support, including add-on bridge courses and language courses to meet international standards.

Potential for extended additional services such as conveyance, boarding & lodging, and transportation, beyond the criteria laid down in the Short-Term Training (STT) guidelines of PMKVY 3.0, as approved by the Executive Committee/State Empowered Committee.
eligibility: Individuals belonging to marginalized or vulnerable groups, such as Scheduled Castes and Tribes, transgender individuals, persons with disabilities, women, economically backward people, or any other category recognized as marginalized/vulnerable by the Government of India and State governments.
Individuals from difficult/remote geographies or hard-to-reach areas, including Left Wing Extremist (LWE) areas, aspirational districts, J&K, Ladakh, North East states, and Island territories.
Mandatory possession of an Aadhaar ID during the enrolment process.
Students must maintain 70% attendance to be eligible to appear in the assessments.
documents: Documents as required for the specific job role.
